ovdesc.p: Each PM enquiry is defined by a parameter record on the PM.ENQ.PARAM file. Each enquiry references a record on this parameter file via the enquiry record itself. Therefore once the format and layout of an enqiury has been fixed it can be copied and different parameter records used to give selective views of the data.
This approach allows the user to modify the data content of the enquiries without any great knowledge of the enquiry system.

The CONSOL.PERIOD field may be used to consolidate dates by standard periods daily, monthly, quarterly, semiannually and anually. This may be done as an alternative to the CALENDAR field. The advantage of this is that rather than being limited to the dates and lengths of time specified in the PM.CALENDAR file, the periods may be open-ended.
Where both this field and the CALENDAR field are left blank, the system will default daily consolidation.
D (or null) data will be consolidated on a daily basis
M data will be consolidated by calendar month
Q data will be consolidated by calendar quarter
S data will be consolidated on a semi-annual basis
A data will be consolidated on an annual basis

Indicates at which point in the calendar record the time periods are to start from in the enquiry.

On an enquiry there is a line for each time period. The time periods are taken from the appropriate record on the PM.CALENDAR file. This field contains the period from which reporting is to start, thus allowing reporting to start from Spot date rather than Calendar date.

1 to 11 alphanumreic characters (Mandatory input) Must be one of the following - Value Meaning CAL Today (Call). TOM Next Working day (Tomorrow). SPT Two working days from Today (Spot). nnD Number of Calendar Days from Spot date. nnW Number of Weeks from Spot date. nnM Number of Months from Spot date. nnY Number of Years from Spot date. * Remainder that is anything after last time period. Note in the above nn equals 01 - 99.
